title: Family Matters
features: Based on the true story of a na√Øve young woman who falls victim to the charms of a smart, handsome and sexy college boy who becomes her abusive (but addictive) husband, this is a romance gone bad. Only through the unwanted efforts of her overly protective family and their questionable connections does she find freedom, independence and eventually love.
description: Teresa Taylor is a former teacher, writer and writing coach who has taught Advanced Placement English and Literature at Brooklyn Technical High School in New York City; Carlotta Paulsen Gymnasium in Hamburg, Germany; and English at Southold High School in Southold, New York. She and her husband, Robert Feger, divide their time between Sarasota, Florida and the North Fork of Long Island, where she continues the teaching, writing and coaching activities that give her life such pleasure.

author: {'avatar': 'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/S/amzn-author-media-prod/uur86p0i9jo6j3e32rjq5k8ui._SY600_.jpg', 'name': 'Teresa Taylor', 'about': ['In 1940 I was born in Brooklyn and was educated there, in every possible way. I was raised by blue-collar parents who expected me to be polite and well mannered, and who suggested I work for the telephone company, where I would always have a job, and a steady pension.', 'Instead I won a Regents scholarship and snagged a part time job in a sporting goods shop (where I learned for the first time in my life what a "cup" was). I was able to afford a local college, St. Joseph\'s College for Women, where I became aware of the flexibility and strength of women, including the nuns who taught us. I wrote about them.', 'I married early and regretted it too late, when my charming handsome husband began to abuse me. I fled to Europe, where I learned a second language, taught American English to young women and occasionally translated an American song into English at their request. I wrote about them, too.', 'Back in Brooklyn, I continued teaching at Brooklyn Tech where I was the happiest girl in the world, and where I found the perfect husband. Eventually we moved to the very east end of Long Island. We are still there, where I write. First book was Family Matters, about how my connected uncle saved me from the first marriage, and Family Rules, a book of fiction that reflects the evils of the world that we all learn as we grow.']}
